CatDescriptText: Alma Clark, 507 Junilla Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "No, there are not enough.  In fact, where are any?  I ask, I think that the city should provide these facilities."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alma Clark wearing dark leather coat with triangular pocket flap and shawl collar, and light colored head scarf, posed in front of block building
